:Definition:: Calculated costs for CO2 emission certificates (current and future) from inputs
Emissions of CO2  (gCO2eq/kWh, tCO2 emitted, % reduced emissions compared to Business as Usual)
Total investment needed (e.g. to communicate the report to a bank)
A synergy index of the energy system expressed via the DOA defined in a publication of RLI
Degree of Autonomy or self sufficiency obtained, typically a number between 0 and 1

Enable the user to carry out this analysis on how to get from current situation to future situation from the other outputs. The pathway itself shall not be output by the simulation as it depends on policies and human political decisions as well
Comparison of different energy systems  and energy mixs (like RLI stemp-mv tool). Could compare energy savings, costs savings, CO2 savings
Percentage of each type of energy sources.
The share of renewable energies in the output energy mix
Energy which could not be stored, or was lost in Joule effect (heating), i.e. losses in heat boilers
The minimal capacity that need to be installed in order to cover the peak powers
Number of new transformers and new cable length required v2.0 of the tool
List of existing technologies which could fulfill the capacity without exceeding the costs

:Name:: Required size of electrolyser and batteries
:Definition:: Required size of electrolyser and batteries
Transfer interfaces with existing supply structures (gas/electricity/water/wastewater)

:Name:: Calculate network requirements or expansion possibilities
:Definition:: Calculate network requirements or expansion possibilities
How many months/years should one wait to get back the money invested in the components/assets
List of support programmes (government, NGO, World Bank) which criteria are fulfilled by the output energy system
